content: I joke about my younger son. I've never had to punish him in his entire life...he's now 14. Maybe I need to get a DNA test done on him as I sure got in my share of trouble in my youth. He's very polite and can yap with anyone from 8 to 98 or he can be off entertaining himself on the guitar or reading a book. Now his older brother (21) was what I call, "normal". He got in trouble from time to time. Now, he's been in the Marine Corps for almost 3 years now so they keep him in line. Don

content: I am the youngest of eight children. It was a full time job to be annoying to all of them.... Actually, my brother Rob (#7) holds the title. When my parents passed we went through all their filed papers. On his second grade report card were the words "tends to annoy others." The rest of us (most in thier 50s) howled over that one, and have never let him live it down. Sullivan013

content: Don't worry about the Specialist. His headache will go away and sooper glue will fix that vase. Bro, I'm sure your cats hair will grow back and the you will eventually get the dials on the TV back to there former positions. Honestly I didn't know a five year old could do that. I did know he could start a car but I had no idea he could get it in gear and completely through the garage and the back wall. I would just put a window and some doors back there while you have the garage in "flux" right now. Your wife will recover from the the culinary mis-step the boys made while she left the kitchen for just a moment. Frankly though I thought the Aloe hand lotion added to the stew and I plan on trying it again. Let me know when you want to have us over again. content: quote: Originally posted by specialist_green: My brother been here three days now and I'm ready for him to leave. If wouldn't be so bad if he came by himself, but he brought a five year old, six year old and a seventeen year old with him. anyone else have this problem ? The problem with kids is that they are in most cases undisciplined. They can be fun but they can be a pain the azz too. I never did talk to my kids with the goo goo talk and don’t my new grandson who lives in Valdosta. I have a way of doing things and it doesn’t include grab azzing or undisciplined kids. I think I was a good parent, was involved with their school, sports, activities, etc but if they acted like jerks I believed in spare the rod spoil the child. I think that’s what’s wrong with most kids today; most have never been disciplined and have no respect for authority. Sharon and I were watching some show on TV the other night and I guess it’s suppose to be funny when some smart azz undisciplined kid jerks an adult around. It’s not because I’m getting older I never gave much quarter to anyone who acted like a jerk.
